trans-unit.source: Allows you to customize the code generated from a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document when using automated query tools.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.Advanced.SchemaImporterExtension"></xref> class.
Handles the importation of the <xsd:any> elements in the schema.
In order to control the generation of the code, you must use the classes found in the <xref:System.CodeDom> namespace.
For more information, see [Using the CodeDOM](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [CodeDOM Quick Reference](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/c77b8bfd-0a32-4e36-b59a-4f687f32c524).
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAny"></xref> that represents the <xref uid="langword_csharp_xsd:any" name="xsd:any" href=""></xref> element found in the XML Schema Document (XSD).
A <xref:System.Boolean> that indicates whether the XSD <xref uid="langword_csharp_complex" name="complex" href=""></xref> attribute has been set to "mixed".
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, if the attribute has been set to mixed, otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemas"></xref> that contains the collection of schemas found in the XSD.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaImporter"></xref> that is the importer being used.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit"></xref> to which you can add CodeDOM structures to generate alternative code for the XSD.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace"></xref> that represents the current namespace for the element.
A <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.CodeGenerationOptions"></xref> for the setting options on the code compiler.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider"></xref> that is the CodeDOM provider used to generate the new code.
The name of the CLR type that the element maps to.
Allows you to specify the default value for the XSD type being imported.
In order to control the generation of the code, you must use the classes found in the <xref:System.CodeDom> namespace.
For more information, see [Using the CodeDOM](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [CodeDOM Quick Reference](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/c77b8bfd-0a32-4e36-b59a-4f687f32c524).
The value found in the original XSD.
The XSD type name.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> setting the new default value.
Allows you to manipulate the code generated by examining the imported schema and specifying the CLR type that it maps to.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType"></xref> that represents the XSD type.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObject"></xref> that represents schema information, such as the line number of the XML element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemas"></xref> that contains the collection of schemas in the document.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaImporter"></xref> that is the importer being used.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit"></xref> to which you can add CodeDOM structures to generate alternative code for the XSD.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace"></xref> that represents the current namespace for the element.
A <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.CodeGenerationOptions"></xref> for the setting options on the code compiler.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider"></xref> that is used to generate the new code.
The name of the CLR type that this maps to.
Allows you to manipulate the code generated by examining the imported schema and specifying the CLR type that it maps to.
In order to control the generation of the code, you must use the classes found in the <xref:System.CodeDom> namespace.
For more information, see [Using the CodeDOM](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [CodeDOM Quick Reference](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/c77b8bfd-0a32-4e36-b59a-4f687f32c524).
The name of the element.
The namespace of the element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObject"></xref> that represents schema information, such as the line number of the XML element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemas"></xref> that contains the collection of schemas in the document.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaImporter"></xref> that is the importer being used.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeCompileUnit"></xref> to which you can add CodeDOM structures to generate alternative code for the XSD.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace"></xref> that represents the current namespace for the element.
A <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.CodeGenerationOptions"></xref> for the setting options on the code compiler.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider"></xref> that is used to generate the new code.
The name of the CLR type that this maps to.
